title: Hint
text:
$$1$$. Recall the formula for the $$n-th$$ term (aₙ) in a geometric sequence:
aₙ $$=$$ a₁ × $$r^{n-1}$$,
where a₁ is the first term and $$r$$ is the common ratio.

$$2$$. Here, the first term a₁ $$=$$ $$16$$ and the common ratio $$r$$ $$=$$ $$ rac{-1}{3}$$. We need the fourth term, which corresponds to $$n$$ $$=$$ $$4$$.

$$3$$. Substitute into the formula:
a₄ $$=$$ $$16$$ × $${\left(- rac{1}{3}ight)}^{4-1}$$
...
